columns.name: name
columns.description: The friendly name that identifies the iam policy.

columns.name: policy_id
columns.description: The stable and unique string identifying the policy.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the iam policy.

columns.name: is_aws_managed
columns.description: Specifies whether the policy is AWS Managed or Customer Managed. If true policy is aws managed otherwise customer managed.

columns.name: is_attachable
columns.description: Specifies whether the policy can be attached to an IAM user, group, or role.

columns.name: create_date
columns.description: The date and time, when the policy was created.

columns.name: update_date
columns.description: The date and time, when the policy was last updated.

columns.name: attachment_count
columns.description: The number of entities (users, groups, and roles) that the policy is attached to.

columns.name: is_attached
columns.description: Specifies whether the policy is attached to at least one IAM user, group, or role.

columns.name: default_version_id
columns.description: The identifier for the version of the policy that is set as the default version.

columns.name: permissions_boundary_usage_count
columns.description: The number of entities (users and roles) for which the policy is used to set the permissions boundary.

columns.name: policy
columns.description: Contains the details about the policy.

columns.name: policy_std
columns.description: Contains the policy in a canonical form for easier searching.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags attached with the IAM policy.
